The @AppropsDems has a Puerto Rico Disaster Supplemental ready to go. It would provide:

üü¶ $100 million for the educational needs of individuals affected by recent disasters & emergencies

üü¶$1.25 billion for repairs to road systems damaged by recent disasters & emergencies
The Trump Administration is more interested in delaying needed repairs than in helping the U.S. citizens living in #PuertoRico. Puerto Rico deserves better: https://t.co/hfGJh1OfgB
This is just another set of roadblocks to recovery, aimed to ensure more delay, more denial, & more ignorance.

It would also provide new oversight authority to the island‚Äôs federally mandated Fiscal Control Board, which is concerning. It is not clear to me that the fiscal control board, or OMB, has the ability to increase the authority of that board without action by Congress.

Reported restrictions on Puerto Rico disaster relief funds are outrageous. They would prevent improvements to the resiliency & reliability of the island's electrical grid. Federal contractors would get paid less than $15 an hour, despite recent executive order mandating the rate.

Proud to join my friend @RepDarrenSoto in calling on @FEMA to act quickly & do everything in its power to help restore power in #PuertoRico. I also urge @realDonaldTrump, once again, to issue a major disaster declaration to help expedite their efforts. https://t.co/mr8LNiSbQa
